dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Sam, winter is approaching fast. We need to make some changes to the restaurant menu.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: You're right. What do you recommend? Our customers have been asking for more soup and hot meals.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: I was thinking we could serve a new mushroom soup with fresh bread. I made it yesterday and it tastes really good.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: That sounds perfect. Did you calculate the cost? We can't waste money on expensive ingredients.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Yes, I calculated the cost this morning. It's very reasonable. We have most ingredients in the cupboard already.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Excellent. But there's something I need to tell you. A food critic is coming here next week.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: A critic? That's important news! We need to be very careful.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: The critic arrived early. He's sitting at the table near the window.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Already? I'm not ready! Can you handle this? I need more time to prepare.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Don't worry. I'll serve him first. What should I recommend?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: The new soup and the winter salad. Make sure the presentation is perfect, not messy.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: He just made a bold claim about restaurant owners. He said we don't care about customers.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: What? That's not true! This affects everyone here. Our whole team works very carefully.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: I know. He's writing something in his book. I can't stop worrying about this.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Let me approach him. We need to show him what we really do here.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Excuse me, sir. I'm the owner. I heard your complaint. Can we talk about this?

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: He wants to see how we make the food. Should we grant him permission to visit the kitchen?

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Yes. The boss grants permission. Come with me, please. I'll show you everything.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Look at this. He's smiling now. I think he likes what he sees.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: He tasted the soup and said it was excellent. He's changing his review!

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: That's wonderful! So he understands we do care about quality and our customers.

dialogue.speaker: Alex
dialogue.text: Yes. He said being honest and open was the best approach. This will attract more visitors to our restaurant.

dialogue.speaker: Sam
dialogue.text: Good. Now we can stop worrying and focus on our menu for winter.
